availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Rice Robinson (Taylor County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Taylor County native. Son of Robert Robinson and Nancy Rice Robinson. Married to Malvina Scott Robinson in 1860. Father of Henry S. Robinson. Confirmed as a notary public in Taylor County on February 5, 1861. Captain of the 27th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from March 21, 1862, to March 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 6.
Charles Kerr, ed. History of Kentucky, Vol V. (Chicago: The American Historical Society, 1922).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 244-45.
Find A Grave, "John R. Robinson (February 23, 1823-March 11, 1899)," Memorial #95179469, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95179469 (accessed April 23, 2018).
KYR-0001-017-0062.
